items.title: Betting buzz: Browns, Panthers end big underdog losing streak
items.summary: After underdogs failed to make much noise in the first two weeks of the NFL season, that all changed in Week 3.

items.title: Source: Colts add CB Hilton after Moore injured
items.summary: Free agent cornerback Mike Hilton has signed with the Colts, a day after slot cornerback Kenny Moore II suffered a calf injury, a source told ESPN's Jeremy Fowler.

items.title: Longtime Pats executive Bobby Grier dies at 82
items.summary: Bobby Grier, whose career as a football coach and front office executive with three NFL teams spanned seven decades, has died, his family confirmed. He was 82.

items.title: Derrick Henry's next-level stiff-arm: 'If it's against me, I want it to be illegal'
items.summary: Henry's signature stiff-arm has helped him become one of the NFL's all-time great running backs.

items.title: Quinshon Judkins shines in first NFL start
items.summary: Sixteen days ago, he wasn't even on the team.

items.title: What did Tom Brady say about his dog? NFL legend goes viral for controversial comment on broadcast
items.summary: Tom Brady slammed for controversial 'kick the dog' comment during live broadcast

items.title: Will Caleb Williams be the first Chicago Bears quarterback to throw 30 touchdown passes in a season?
items.summary: NFL analyst debates whether Chicago Bears quarterback Caleb Williams will throw for 30 touchdowns this season.

items.title: Sports betting roundup: NFL Week 3 brings thrills, big swings for bettors
items.summary: Week 3 of the NFL season featured the most thrilling set of games in a while.  According to the Elias Sports Bureau, there were seven NFL games in which the winning score came within the final 3 minutes of the fourth quarter, the most such games in a single day since the 1970 merger.  In addition, there was plenty of action in college football in Week 4.

items.title: The Steelers have made 'how did they do that?' victories an art form under Mike Tomlin
items.summary: The trick to going nearly two decades without a losing season is to find a way to pull out a victory or two along the way that maybe you shouldn't have.  How Pittsburgh gets there is immaterial, at least to Tomlin.  “It's good to win in the NFL,” Tomlin said after beating the Patriots on the road for the first time in 17 years.

items.title: Big questions from NFL Week 3: How concerning is Cowboys' defense? Did Chiefs' offense find something?
items.summary: NFL Nation reporters react to all the action, answering the biggest questions coming out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 3.

items.title: Colts sign Corner Mike Hilton
items.summary: Monday morning news broke that the Colts are signing veteran CB Mike Hilton to the Practice Squad, and potentially activate the veteran to the active roster after watching a few practices and getting him up to speed. The Colts previously worked out Hilton leading up to their Week 1 matchup with the Dolphins, who he […]

items.title: Around the AFC South: Texans drop to 0-3 with loss to Jaguars
items.summary: The Colts improved to 3-0 with their win over the Titans on Sunday.

items.title: Colts’ Monday Morning Awards: Week 3 @Titans
items.summary: 3-0 as the perfect Colts dominate against the Titans, away from home, on a key divisional game to gain control of the AFC South. It was never close as Indy got the early lead and then ran away with it, thanks to a dominant JT, and a stifling defense that, despite the heat, managed to […]

items.title: Daniel Jones and Jonathan Taylor have been the best tandem in football through 3 weeks
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts are 3-0 and playing some of the best football in the league. They own the NFL’s top point differential, and it all starts with an offense that has been dynamic both through the air and on the ground. The pairing of Daniel Jones and Jonathan Taylor may have seemed unusual on paper […]

items.title: Colts enter NFL history books with one punt in first three games of 2025
items.summary: The Colts are the first team to punt only once in the first three games of an NFL season since at least 1940.

items.title: Gridiron Necromancy Week 3
items.summary: The 2025 Indianapolis Colts are 3-0 and breaking offensive franchise records. A franchise that has been led by the likes of Johnny Unitas, Bert Jones, Peyton Manning and Andrew Luck is having a point scoring renaissance powered by former first round bust Daniel Jones. The Jones led Colts have scored 103 points through three games […]

items.title: How Dan Campbell's 'kneecap speech' forever changed the NFL and the Detroit Lions
items.summary: Campbell was mocked for his introductory presser with the Lions. But players, execs and fans loved it -- and knew they had their guy.

items.title: 'Do you like apples?': Steelers' nods to Boston-based actors lead NFL Week 3 trolls
items.summary: NFL teams were plenty petty in Week 3, led by the Pittsburgh Steelers poking fun at the New England Patriots.

items.title: Best of NFL Week 3's arrivals, featuring Patrick Mahomes' clean suit before 'SNF'
items.summary: The stars are back in the pregame tunnels strutting their stuff with fits tailored to their style.

items.title: 'We were fed up': Panthers' defense comes alive
items.summary: The NFL's worst defense last season was a big reason why the Panthers got their first win of 2025.

items.title: Shane Steichen’s ‘throw to score, run to win’ philosophy is paying dividends for Colts offense
items.summary: Indianapolis, IN — When Shane Steichen was brought in to be the next head coach of the Indianapolis Colts, he had quite the journey ahead of him. Returning to square one after developing quarterbacks Justin Herbert and Jalen Hurts into the basis of what they’ve become, respectively, Steichen’s uphill battle as a first-time head coach […]

items.title: Colts-Rams opening odds: Colts look to add to early success
items.summary: Beating the Rams, whether it be the St. Louis or Los Angeles iteration has proven difficult. It has been such a challenge for the Indianapolis Colts that they haven’t done it since 2009. This appears to be a season of changes, however, so this is as good a time as ever to break the current […]

items.title: Colts steamroll over Titans 41-20 to continue impressive start
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts are singing in cadence. “I’m a steam roller baby.” “And I’m rolling down the line” “I’m a steam roller baby” “And I’m rolling down the line” “So you better get out of my way now” “Before I roll all over you.” The Colts never trailed from the opening snap and left no […]

items.title: Colts hot offensive start continues
items.summary: 3-0. The Indianapolis Colts continue adding to their win total in 2025 and remain unbeaten having downed the Tennessee Titans in their first road game of the season. The first divisional win has them up three games up over not only the Titans but also the Texans. The Jaguars aren’t far behind, but it is […]

items.title: Michael Pittman Jr. on Colts’ 3-0 start: ‘We thought we were this team'
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — It was business as usual Sunday in Nashville, Tennessee. Except for, that is, Anthony Richardson Sr. taking meaningful snaps for the first time this season and Rigoberto Sanchez finally launching a punt that’s in the official box score. “It was a helluva punt,’’ Shane Steichen said of Sanchez’s first punt after 19 consecutive [...]

items.title: Colts star RB Jonathan Taylor terrorizes Titans in blowout 41-20 road win
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts had their first taste of the AFC South for the 2025 campaign and came away with a convincing 41-20 road win against their rival Tennessee Titans—which was music to Colts fans’ ears! While it felt early on like an AFC South game, with neither side seemingly pulling away from the other, and […]

items.title: 'There's nobody else playing like him:' Jonathan Taylor continues punishing start to 2025 in Colts' win over Titans
items.summary: Jonathan Taylor rushed for three touchdowns in the Colts' 41-20 win over the Tennessee Titans in Week 3, and his 338 rushing yards over the first three games of 2025 broke a franchise record set by Eric Dickerson 38 years ago.

items.title: NFL Week 3 is full of trap games; that the Colts didn't just avoid one, but blew out the Titans, might say a lot about this team
items.summary: The Colts preached focus and discipline leading up to Sunday's trip to Nashville to face the Tennessee Titans – and left with a 41-20 thumping of their AFC South rival, improving to 3-0 on the season.

items.title: 'Lightning in a bottle:' How Kenny Moore II's pick-six set tone in Colts' emphatic win over Titans
items.summary: The cornerback’s pick-six on Sunday was the fourth of his career.

items.title: Colts cruise past Titans, 41-20, to improve to 3-0
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — The Indianapolis Colts took the lead three plays into their AFC South matchup with the Tennessee Titans in Nashville on Sunday afternoon and never looked back, winning 41-20 and improving to 3-0 to start the season. Defensive back Kenny Moore II intercepted Titans' rookie quarterback Cam Ward on the third play from scrimmage [...]

items.title: Jonathan Taylor, Colts roll past Titans; improve to 3-0 for first time since 2009
items.summary: The Colts blew out the Tennessee Titans, 41-20, on Sunday at Nissan Stadium to improve to 3-0 on the 2025 season.

items.title: Week 3 Colts vs. Titans Game Thread
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts are on the road to take on the Tennessee Titans in week 3 of the 2025 season, kickoff is at 1:00 p.m. EST. The 2025 Indianapolis Colts, led by Daniel Jones at quarterback, have accomplished something the Andrew Luck Colts never did: they have started their season 2-0. And they’ve done so on the […]

items.title: Sideline to Sideline: Favorite NFL Stadiums
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS - Every week Blue Zone's Chris Widlic goes "Sideline to Sideline" with the Colts asking one question. This week Chris asks the players what they're favorite NFL city or stadium is as they play their first road game of the year in Tennessee.

items.title: Keys to the Game: Colts at Titans
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS - The Colts aim to go 3-0 to start the season as they play their first road and divisional game when they visit the Tennessee Titans. IndyStar Colts' insider has his keys to the game to keep the Titans winless.

items.title: Colts announce 5 inactive players for Week 3 game vs. Tennessee Titans
items.summary: No Colts players were ruled out due to injury for Sunday's game against the Titans at Nissan Stadium.

items.title: How to watch the Indianapolis Colts at Tennessee Titans on September 21, 2025
items.summary: TV broadcast, radio and streaming information for Indianapolis Colts at Tennessee Titans on Sunday, September 21 at 1:00 p.m. ET (Week 3).

items.title: Colts at Titans: What to watch for
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Areas of interest in the Indianapolis Colts’ Sunday meeting with the Tennessee Titans at Nissan Stadium in Nashville. *Kickoff: 1 p.m. *Broadcast: CBS4. *Spread: Colts by 4½. *History lesson, Part I: The Colts lead the overall series 39-22 and have won four straight. Prior to that, the Titans won five straight. Six of the last seven meetings [...]

items.title: Colts lift 'questionable' designations for TE Tyler Warren, CB Charvarius Ward Sr. ahead of Week 3 game vs. Titans
items.summary: Ward (concussion) and Warren (toe) were listed as questionable on Friday's practice report.

items.title: Colts relatively healthy heading into AFC South matchup at Titans
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – As they dive into divisional competition and seek their first 3-0 start since 2009, the Indianapolis Colts appear to have one thing in their favor. Their health. Yes, knock on wood. With Sunday’s AFC South test against the Tennessee Titans in Nashville looming, Shane Steichen offered an encouraging injury update. “No one is [...]

items.title: Colts do not rule out any players for Week 3 game vs. Tennessee Titans
items.summary: After missing Wednesday's practice with a toe injury, tight end Tyler Warren participated in practice on Thursday and Friday.

items.title: Colts-Titans preview: Why Colts aren't reading into records or stats heading into AFC South matchup against winless Titans
items.summary: The 2-0 Colts head to Nashville for their first road game – and first AFC South contest – of the 2025 season on Sunday against the Tennessee Titans at Nissan Stadium. But while the Colts' start to 2025 has been the opposite of the Titans', head coach Shane Steichen and team leaders feel they have this team in a good spot to avoid any sort of letdown game in Week 3.

items.title: No punts in 2 games? It’s a first for Rigoberto Sanchez and just second time for Colts
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – It’s what you call a statistical anomaly. Or. “Wild,’’ offered Rigoberto Sanchez. “Wild. Crazy.’’ He’s the Indianapolis Colts veteran punter whose name doesn’t appear in the NFL stats. Two games. Zero punts. “Never happened before,’’ Sanchez said. Not at California’s Hamilton High School. Or at Hawaii. Or in his first 113 games with [...]

items.title: Through the first two weeks of his rookie NFL season, Tyler Warren is continuing to show he's one of one
items.summary: Warren, who won NFL Rookie of the Week honors for Week 2, returned to practice on Thursday after missing Wednesday with a toe injury.

items.title: Ed Sheeran adds Lucas Oil Stadium to North American leg of worldwide "Loop Tour"
items.summary: Colts season ticket member presale begins Thursday, September 25. General on-sale starting Friday, September 26.

items.title: The Colts Show Mailbag: Red zone offense, pressuring opposing quarterbacks, first road game of 2025
items.summary: The Colts Show Mailbag returns for Week 3 as JJ Stankevitz answers listener, viewer and reader questions on both this week's podcast and Colts.com.

items.title: Colts' offense thriving on early downs, but eyeing improvements in red zone
items.summary: The Colts have been one of the NFL's best offenses to begin the 2025 season largely because of their success on first and second down; that success, though, has come with a recognition that this group collectively needs to be better at scoring touchdowns in the red zone.

items.title: Colts TE Tyler Warren wins Week 2 NFL Rookie of the Week
items.summary: Warren continued a torrid start to his NFL career with four catches for 79 yards in the Colts' 29-28 win over the Denver Broncos in Week 2.

items.title: Former Colts Pro Bowl tight end Jack Doyle on Jonathan Taylor: 'Jonathan's a stud'
items.summary: Voice of the Colts Matt Taylor and two-time Colts Pro Bowl tight end Jack Doyle discussed Jonathan Taylor's stellar performance against the Denver Broncos, the running back's relationship with Daniel Jones and much more on this week's episode of The Jack Doyle Show

items.title: Colts on fire to start 2025 regular season. Bring the family & celebrate together!

items.title: Good things happening as Daniel Jones once again paired with elite RB (Jonathan Taylor)
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – It’s been just two games, but the cause and effect is undeniable. Give Daniel Jones a viable and vibrant run game, and all things are possible. “It makes a tremendous impact, a running back like that who can hit the big one, hit the home run, who can make it happen late in [...]

items.title: How Colts QB Daniel Jones is handling near-historic level of blitzes to begin 2025 season
items.summary: Jones has been blitzed on 50 dropbacks over his first two games, per Pro Football Focus, which isn't just the highest total in the NFL this season – it's the highest total to begin a season in over a decade.

items.title: 'What it's all about:' Colts players attend fourth annual Colts Unified Flag Classic
items.summary: On Tuesday, the Colts hosted the fourth annual Colts Unified Flag Classic in partnership with Special Olympics Indiana and the Indiana High School Athletic Association.

items.title: Colts’ Jonathan Taylor AFC Offensive Player of the Week
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Jonathan Taylor’s latest breakout game caught the attention of the league office. The Indianapolis Colts’ veteran running back has been named AFC Offensive Player of the Week on the strength of his performance in Sunday’s 29-28 win over Denver. Taylor rushed 25 times for 165 yards and added 50 yards and a touchdown [...]

items.title: Colts RB Jonathan Taylor named AFC Offensive Player of the Week for Week 2
items.summary: Taylor had 25 carries for 165 yards, and two receptions for 50 yards and a touchdown in the Colts' win over the Denver Broncos.

items.title: Why Colts, Shane Steichen had confidence in Spencer Shrader to make 60-yard field goal vs. Broncos
items.summary: Shrader missed his 60-yard field goal attempt on Sunday, but not because he didn't have the strength to get the ball through the uprights.

items.title: Colts release unofficial depth chart for Week 3 game vs. Tennessee Titans
items.summary: The Colts released their Week 3 unofficial depth chart ahead of their game against the Tennessee Titans Sunday at Nissan Stadium. Check it out below:

items.title: Colts sign LB Austin Ajiake to 53-man roster; sign C Jimmy Morrissey to practice squad
items.summary: The Colts made the roster moves on Tuesday.

items.title: Colts TE Tyler Warren nominated for NFL Rookie of the Week for Week 2
Colts’ Shane Steichen: Should have been more aggressive on game-winning field goal drive
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Shane Steichen offered a mea culpa, and those are always easier to deal with after what transpired Sunday at Lucas Oil Stadium. Less than 24 hours after his Indianapolis Colts chased down Denver 29-28 as time expired on Spencer Shrader’s 45-yard field goal, Steichen conceded he made things more difficult than they needed [...]

items.title: 5 Colts Things: Daniel Jones handles Broncos' pressure, Jonathan Taylor excels with and without the ball, Grover Stewart again assists a Cam Bynum interception and context for Denver's leverage penalty
items.summary: The Colts improved to 2-0 for the first time since 2009 with a dramatic 29-28 win over the Denver Broncos on Sunday at Lucas Oil Stadium.
